description: Number of distinct primes dividing phi of n-th primorial number.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For primorials with 10, 100, or 1000 prime factors, their totients have only 5, 32 or 241 prime divisors, corresponding to a(10), a(100), and a(1000).
prog: (Haskell)a055768 = a001221 . a005867  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 01 2013(PARI) a(n)=omega(lcm(apply(p->p-1, primes(n)))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 12 2000
